00040 #ifndef _worldquerytool_h
00041 #define _worldquerytool_h
00042 
00043 #include "world.h"
00044 #include "actorbase.h"
00045 #include "vector3wactor.h"
00046 #include "metacode.h"
00047 #include "ray.h"
00048 #include "plane.h"

00050 #include <bitset>
00051 
00052 namespace Ogre
00053 {
00054     class RaySceneQuery;
00055     class Vector3;
00056     class Quaternion;
00057     class Entity;

00059 
00060 namespace phys
00061 {
00062     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00063     /// @class WorldQueryTool
00064     /// @headerfile worldquerytool.h
00065     /// @brief This provides a number of optional tools for working with a phys::World
00066     /// @details Currently this allows for more seamless mouse use, including 'picking'
00067     /// of objects with the mouse, and associated functionality.
00068     ///////////////////////////////////////
00069     class WorldQueryTool
00070     {
00071         private:
00072             /// @internal
00073             /// @brief This is gameworld we will be querying
00074             World* GameWorld;
00075 
00076             /// @internal
00077             /// @brief This holds the Mouse X coordinate as of the last time Gather Events was called
00078             Whole MouseXCache;
00079 
00080             /// @internal
00081             /// @brief This holds the Mouse Y coordinate as of the last time Gather Events was called
00082             Whole MouseYCache;
00083 
00084             /// @internal
00085             /// @brief This is the mouse button limit of this class.
00086             const static unsigned short int MouseButtonLimit = 16;
00087 
00088             /// @internal
00089             /// @brief A place to store which mouse buttons are pushed.
00090             std::bitset<MouseButtonLimit> MouseButtonCache;
00091 
00092             /// @internal
00093             /// @brief A place to store which keys are pressed or not.
00094             std::bitset<MetaCode::KEY_LAST> KeyboardButtonCache;
00095 
00096             /// @internal
00097             /// @brief An Ogre construct used to find information about the locations of graphical object
00098             Ogre::RaySceneQuery* RayQuery;
00099 
00100 
00101             /// @internal
00102             /// @brief used to get information about 3d graphical objects at specific locations
00103             void GetMeshInformation(Ogre::Entity *entity,
00104                                 size_t &vertex_count,
00105                                 Ogre::Vector3* &vertices,
00106                                 size_t &index_count,
00107                                 unsigned long* &indices,
00108                                 const Ogre::Vector3 &position,
00109                                 const Ogre::Quaternion &orient,
00110                                 const Ogre::Vector3 &scale);
00111 
00112         public:
00113             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00114             // Basic Stuff
00115             ///////////////////////////////////////
00116             /// @brief Basic Constructor.
00117             /// @details This creates a WorldQueryTool Ready to run queries on the the world you pass it.
00118             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World to be queried
00119             WorldQueryTool(World* GameWorld_);
00120 
00121             /// @brief Destructor
00122             /// @details Deletes everything in the world query tool.
00123             ~WorldQueryTool();
00124 
00125             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00126             // Simple User Input Queries
00127             ///////////////////////////////////////
00128             /// @brief This gets the X coordinate of the mouse
00129             /// @details This gets the X location of this mouse. This runs in constant time.
00130             /// @return This returns a Whole number which represents the X coordinate of the mouse.
00131             Whole GetMouseX();
00132 
00133             /// @brief This gets the Y coordinate of the mouse
00134             /// @details This gets the Y location of this mouse. This runs in constant time.
00135             /// @return This returns a Whole number which represents the Y coordinate of the mouse.
00136             Whole GetMouseY();
00137 
00138             /// @brief Returns whether a specific Mouse button is pushed
00139             /// @details This runs in constant time and returns a true is the requested mouse button is pressed. Buttons that are being pressed
00140             /// are considered pressed, and buttons that are being lifted are considered unpressed. This only supports the first 16 mouse buttons
00141             /// at this point (numbered 0 to 15)
00142             /// @param MouseButton This is the mouse button that is being checked
00143             /// @exception "Unsupported mouse button access through WorldQueryTool" This is thrown whenever a mouse button is requested that is beyond the limit that is supported. Currently this limit is 16
00144             /// @return This returns a bool which is set to true if the requested button is pressed or held down, and false otherwise.
00145             bool IsMouseButtonPushed(short unsigned int MouseButton);
00146 
00147             /// @brief Returns whether a specific KEyboard button is pushed
00148             /// @details This runs in constant time and returns a true is the requested mouse button is pressed. Buttons that are being pressed
00149             /// are considered pressed, and buttons that are being lifted are considered unpressed.
00150             /// @param KeyboardButton This is the button that is being checked.
00151             // This functionality has not yet been implemented @exception "Unsupported Keyboard button" This is thrown whenever a button is requested that is beyond the limit that is supported. See
00152             /// @return This returns a bool which is set to true if the requested button is pressed or held down, and false otherwise.
00153             bool IsKeyboardButtonPushed(MetaCode::InputCode KeyboardButton);
00154 
00155             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00156             // World Ray Queries
00157             ///////////////////////////////////////
00158             /// @brief This will find the first Actor to intesect the Given ray.
00159             /// @details This use the graphics subsystem to cast a ray in the world. If the ray passes through any the triangles in an actor
00160             /// This will return that actor. This function runs in linear time relative to the amount of triangles in 3d meshes near the the
00161             /// ray being cast. This will start at ray.from and go to ray.to .
00162             /// @param ActorRay The Ray to search along.
00163             /// @return This returns a pointer to an Vector3WActor, which contains the first actor along the ray and the point of intersection Relative to the actor
00164             Vector3WActor* GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon(Ray ActorRay);
00165 
00166             /// @brief Partially implemented. This should find the first Actor that is on or almost on the a given Ray.
00167             /// @details This casts a ray through the gameworld. The first actor with an Axis Aligned Bounding Box that intersects that ray is returned.
00168             /// Presently this is untested and does not return the Offset of the intersection. This should perform faster than WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon
00169             /// but not by a known amount.
00170             /// @param ActorRay The Ray to search along.
00171             /// @return This returns a pointer to an actorbase, which is the first actor to have an Axis-Aligned Bounding Box along the ray.
00172             Vector3WActor* GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB(Ray ActorRay);
00173 
00174             /// @brief This will find the actor under the mouse.
00175             /// @details This will use
00176             /// @param UsePolygon If true this will use GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon, otherwise this will use GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB .
00177             /// @param RayLength The length of the ray to cast from te mouse to search for actors. This defaults to 1000.0
00178             /// @return This returns a Vector3WActor which has a pointer to the actor under the mouse, and a vector representing the distance of the mouse fromt the center of mass.
00179             Vector3WActor* GetActorUnderMouse(Real RayLength=1000.0, bool UsePolygon=true);
00180 
00181             /// @brief Where does this Ray Meet this Plane?
00182             /// @details This does some fancy math to return the point where the ray and the plane intersent.
00183             /// This returns a NULL pointer in the event the ray and plane do not meet, or are completely coterminous.
00184             /// @param QueryRay This is the Ray that could intersent the plane
00185             /// @param QueryPlane This is the plane to be interesected.
00186             /// @return This returns a pointer to a vector that matches where the intersection of the plane and Ray, if possible
00187             Vector3* RayPlaneIntersection(const Ray &QueryRay, const Plane &QueryPlane);
00188 
00189             /// @brief Get a Ray from the current viewport, following the mouse
00190             /// @details This calls on the graphics subsystem to get a ray from the location of the current camera
00191             /// @param Length how long of a ray do you want? Thsi defaults to 1000
00192             /// @return This returns a ray that matches originates at the camera and goes out in 3d space behind the mouse pointer.
00193             Ray* GetMouseRay(Real Length=1000);
00194 
00195             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00196             // Basic Stuff
00197             ///////////////////////////////////////
00198             /// @brief This gathers any user-input/event data that might be queryed
00199             /// @details This should be called periodcally (ideally in the post user input callback) to allow this
00200             /// to gather data from the phys::World 's event manager. When called this will drop prior event data
00201             /// and any relevant queries will come from this new data. At the caller's discretion this method
00202             /// can properly delete any events pulled from the event manager. \n \n
00203             /// This runs in linear time relative to the events in the event manager. This will usually be a trivial amount
00204             /// if this is run each iteration and excess events are removed (either by this method or some other form of event cleanup)
00205             /// @param ClearEventsFromEventMgr If set to true, This method will properly remove any events it pulls from the event manager.
00206             void GatherEvents(bool ClearEventsFromEventMgr = false);
00207     };
00208 }

00212 #endif
